posts.cooked:
A message such as: “At the store right now, will be back in 20 minutes” or “I will be responding to messages during office hours, between 9:00 and 18:00.” or “Watching a movie right now, will be back later”.

It should not become like the Whatsapp status with photo which gets removed after 24 hours. That is a social status, not an away status. Just making clear that I am not asking for something like that.
The feature I am requesting is a textual status message which the user can set to indicate when he is expecting to answer his messages.

Where this status should be visible (as an automatic replay message or at the top of a conversation) is subject to discussion. That is why I am not yet sure if we should call it an “away status” or an “away message” or a “away status message”.
What privacy implications this feature may bring (will all contacts see the status?) is of course also subject of discussion.

I would prefer something more elaborate than that, as you can see in the examples I have given.

There should be some flexibility to provide a reason, or give a time indication when the user expects to be back. This is much more useful when for example using Signal for a work conference call, and one of the coworkers has provided in his away status message that he had to go pick up his kids, but will be back in 30 minutes. This is useful information to the others in the group, and enhances communication.

Do note that not all of his contacts need to know that he is picking up his kids, and that he isn’t at his home right now. An away status should be visible to a selected group of contacts.

posts.name: Meteor0id
posts.cooked:
I totally agree that this feature is not a priority at this time, and it would require significant design decisions. I wrote this feature request because I see in a couple of other forum topics that people are looking for some way of letting others know they won’t be available for a while. There is a need for something, and it isn’t there yet. Instead of doing what Whatsapp and Telegram have done (an online indicator) I came up with this feature, as a privacy friendly solution.

So far I think we have determined:

  • There is a need to let people know you won’t be responding any time soon.
  • There is a need to indicate how long you think it will take before you get back to responding to messages.
  • An “online” or “last-seen” indicator, even if optional, is not the most privacy friendly solution available.
    Such an indicator always gives away more information than necessary. Making it optional does not warrant calling it privacy friendly, because no privacy friendly alternative would be available. This rules out an “online” indicator, or “last-seen” indicator as a solution. (besides, it still doesn’t indicate when you expect to come on-line again.)
  • When a contact has read a message, is a different issue entirely: Expose (delivery and) read receipt times in all conversations
  • To preserve privacy, one must be able to select which contacts can see the away status. This would require significant user interface design effort, but privacy is a minimum / hard requirement for any feature in Signal. It would probably look like selecting contacts to add to a group.
  • The feature should be designed to only be used for indicating that you will be unavailable. It must not become a way of sharing some kind of profile information text. This could be prevented by making the text message hard-coded, and the time selectable (with the option to not select any time).
    “I might not be available for a while. Expecting to read my messages again in 3 days” (with the time counting down, because it was set on a date-time just like an appointment or alarm).
    Instead of a text solution, an indicator could be used, provided its meaning can be conveyed clearly.
  • The away status should be show to (selected) contacts before they even start typing.

I will revive this topic, since I wanted to create a similar one, but the forum notified me that this one exists.

Since I am working from home for two weeks already, I really miss the ability to set some sort of status, exactly like the ones described above by fellow forum colleagues.

I particularly like Skype implementation where you can set the status, along with a cute emoji (even an animated one). The emoji will be displayed on the chat list and the text only if you hover the contact (on mobile, when you long press, maybe).

I miss the ability to set:

  • Working from home
  • At lunch
  • Busy
  • In a meeting

IMO, a status functionality could be represented by:

  • online/offline status (disabled by default)
  • status: Away, Busy, Lets Chat, Do Not Dirsturb, Custom/Disabled

Both are obviously reciprocal: if I deactivate mine, I will not be able to see that of the others and vice versa

posts.cooked: Is this solved by the new status feature?

What is this supposed “status feature”?

I have a more specific desire in this case: the capacity to simply indicate to other people when a device is set to mute or do-not-disturb. The point is: when people are trying to reach me, they can see that I am not going to get a sound to draw my attention, so they have clear expectation that I won’t see the message for a while. This is a form of “away status” as various instant-message apps have had for years. I haven’t seen such a feature exist in any way in Signal yet.
